meanings.definition: Make a soft, muffled crackling sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves rustling in the gentle breeze sounded soothing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the papers rustling as she searched for the right document.
meanings.sent3: The chipmunk thought the rustling of the leaves was a secret message from the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rustled through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind rustling the curtains made the room feel alive.

meanings.definition: The action of moving with a soft, muffled crackling sound.
meanings.sent1: The rustling of the bushes signaled the approach of a small animal.
meanings.sent2: The rustling of the leaves underfoot added to the peaceful atmosphere of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The rustling of the paper bag made the cat believe it was a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The rustling of the pages in the old book echoed through the library.
meanings.sent5: The rustling of the wind in the trees created a calming melody.

meanings.sent1: The sheriff was on the lookout for any signs of rustling in the area.
meanings.sent2: The farmer installed security cameras to prevent any rustling of his produce.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a failed attempt at rustling.
meanings.sent4: The news reported a case of rustling that left the whole town shocked.
meanings.sent5: The movie depicted a daring rustling operation that kept viewers on the edge of their seats.
